body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Executive Department

Whereas it has been made known to me, Beriah Magoffin Governor of The Commonwealth aforesaid. That Jane, (a slave) has been convicted for the Crime of Murder, and Judgment of death has been pronounced against her by the Circuit Court for Owen County a copy of which is in the words of following, viz.

"Owen Circuit Court
July Term 1860 July 14

The Comth. of Ky Plff
vs
Jane Deft

The court being about to adjourn the defendant this day brought into Court, and being informed of the nature of the indictment, plea and verdict was asked if she had any legal Cause to show why Judgment should not be pronounced against her and none being shown it is adjudged by the Court that the Defendant be taken to jail and there safely kept until the 14th day of September 1860 in which day between Sunrise and Sunset the Sheriff of Owen County Shall hang her by the neck until She is dead

A Copy
Attest Leslie Combs C. C. A"

And whereas upon an appeal duly prayed and granted the Court of Appeals of
Said Commonwealth in Said Case has affirmed Said Judgment of death against Said Jane, as I have been informed by a certificate of the affirmance which is in the following words
viz:

"The State of Kentucky
Court of Appeals } 22d October 1860

Jane (A Slave) Appellant
against } Appeal from a Judgment of the Owen Circuit Court
Commonwealth Appellee
The Court being Sufficiently advised, it Seems to them that there is no error in the Judgment herein.
It is therefore Considered that Said Judgment be approved.
Which is ordered to be certified to Said Court.

A Copy -- Attest
Leslie Combs C. C. A."
And whereas the day fixed by the Judgment of the Circuit Court aforesaid has past.

Now in obedience to the law in Such cases, made and provided. I Beriah Magoffin, Governor as aforeSaid, Send this my warrent of Execution to the Sheriff of Said County of Owen and hereby Command him, that on the 14th day of December next between Sunrise and Sunset
of that day, that he the Said Sheriff of Owen County do execute the Judgment aforesaid by hanging the Said Jane by the neck, until She is dead.

SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
In Testimony Whereof I have herewith Set my hand and Caused the Seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed. Done at Frankfort this 10th day of November A.D. 1860 And in the 69th Year of the Commonwealth.

By the Governor. B. Magoffin
Tho. B Monroe Jr. Secretary of State
By Jas W. Tate Asst. Secy:

By virtue of the within warrant I Did on the 13th Day of the prsent month Demand of the Jailor of Gallatin County Ky. the body of Jane (a slave) mentioned herein, she being there confined, Exhibiting to him this warrant upon which he informed me that the said Jane had escaped from custody, by breaking Jail on the night of the 10th Inst. and he was thereby unable to comply with the Demand. The Statement of Said Jailor, in writing, is filed herewith, and refered to as a part of this return, And in consequence of such escape, I am unable to execute the judgment of the Court as herein Directed --

J. R. Mordoff D. S. For
B. F. s. c. O
Owen Co
Return of the sheriff upon the Governors Warrant of Execution of Jane a slave

Return not executed
Dec. 21. 1861
